arm_group.description: Web-based registry of invasive infections by emerging fungi

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this registry is to broaden the knowledge on epidemiology, diagnostic
      procedures and clinical course of emerging invasive fungal infections.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fungiscope - A Global Emerging Fungal Infection Registry

detailed_description.textblock:
The specific objectives are:

        1. To determine the fungal species causing invasive fungal infection in different parts of
           the world.

        2. To determine the clinical pattern of disease and document procedures performed for
           confirmation of the diagnosis.

        3. To describe the therapeutic regimens used and their efficacy.

        4. To share clinical isolates among the contributors of Fungiscope.

        5. To develop molecular biology tools for identification of strains in histopathologically
           proven invasive fungal infection.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Cultural, histopathological, antigen, or DNA evidence of invasive fungal infection

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Infection due to Aspergillus spp., Candida spp., Cryptococcus neoformans,
             Pneumocystis jiroveci

          -  Endemic fungal infection such as coccidioidomycosis or histoplasmosis

          -  Colonisation or other non-invasive infection

study_pop.textblock: Invasive infections caused by emerging fungi

link.description: Fungiscope - A Global Emerging Fungal Infection Registry

clinical_study.official_title: Fungiscope - A Global Emerging Fungal Infection Registry

oversight_info.authority: Germany: German Institute of Medical Documentation and Information

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment efficacy of emerging fungal infections (failure, stable disease, partial response or complete response)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
